title: Word for Northerners
content:
With English orthography becoming standardized throughout the world, the local pronunciation of a document's writer isn't apparent. Not like it is in a Robbie Burns poem, for instance.   
   
"Man" is pronounced with a nasal accent in the Southern States ("men"), but with a guttural accent ("mun") in Northern England.   
   
But some are working to make text more true to life. We've had the Shizzolator, and now: [Word for Northerners](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051639/http:/www.shinntype.com/wordfornortherners_.doc)
author: scoffer

comments.content:
It sounds like it's about Yorkshire, which is Southern as far as I am concerned (up in the proper North).   
   
hehehe   
   
Jim
